Good Morning Bears!
Did you know that today is #NationalTeddyBEARday? History has it that in 1902, that US President Theodore Roosevelt refused to shoot a bear cub while hunting in Mississippi and the incident made national news. Clifford Berryman published a cartoon of the event in the Washington Post and the caricature became an instant classic.

The cartoon then inspired New York store owner Morris Michtom to create a new toy. Mr. Michtom wrote President Roosevelt to ask permission to name the new toy a “Teddy Bear.” And, the rest is history...

So - today, we want to celebrate by inviting our BEAR community to #ShareaBear with someone you love, or perhaps someone that might need that extra #bearlove 💙💛

Our challenge to you this week is to snag a teddy bear and drop it off on someone's porch or in their mail and let them know the Bear Community loves them. 🐻

We hope you have a great Wednesday!

Good Morning Bear Nation!
We are SO excited to introduce a new sidekick to our media centers to you. Meet Sora!

She is the educational side of Overdrive used by the majority of public libraries across the United States for eBook and audio books. Not only will we have our own collection of books, we will also be tied to Chandler Public Library so we can check out their books too...without a library card! The different campuses across the district have invited teachers to schedule a time for classes to come and learn more about Sora and how to assist our readers in using the program...but I bet you will even find our teachers and staff searching for a new favorite book to read too! 📚

But, why wait? You can start exploring now. Just follow the link to learn more...let your imagination SOAR with SORA! ☁️✈️🚀

Happy National Assistant Principals Week!

We love the chance to celebrate these incredible leaders on our campuses. Will you help us show them our biggest #BearLove?!

Assistant Principals do more behind the scenes than we realize - many of them are in charge of discipline (the not so fun part, but necessary) but do so because they know the importance of that job. They spend hours on paperwork that is required by the state that we never see. They hear stories that some of us don’t ever want to know because they are a listening ear to not just students, but staff.

They are educational heroes to many. They are our rocks and our inspirations. We celebrate YOU all this week. Thanks for choosing #BearNation as your professional home.

#APWeek

How often do you find your superintendent BEHIND the concession stand, serving your patrons and guests?

Not often. Maybe not ever.

But, at BISD, you will find Dr. Keri Hampton - everywhere.

She is our leader. The one at the “top” that doesn’t have a special month or week to celebrate her. She helps solve problems and helps lead leaders. She encourages teachers and believes in our students - all of them to accomplish BIG things. And she is a SERVANT. She drops everything to make sure “her people” are taken care of and able to do their job every day. It may be just a Wednesday night to you, but let’s make this a Dr. Hampton night. Let’s show her some love - just because we LOVE her.

Thank you, Dr. H for your leadership and selfless work you do every day that many of us never get to see. We are so thankful for YOU. 💙💛🐻

A BIG congratulations to our UIL Academic Film Team and their incredible Coach, Mr. Noah McBryde. This is the first year we have had a UIL Film team and they had a very successful year. The team produced 4 films and three of them went on to the 2nd level of competition, and 1, "Perfect Family" made it to sem-finals. The film finished 4th and barely missed going to state by one place (the top three advance). It was also nominated for the Nobility Social Impact Award. 💛💙🎬🎥

Help us congratulate this hard-working, creative team and their coach! When you have some time, take a 2nd and watch all of their films - 100% directed and produced by our Brownsboro High School students!

The film team includes: Rylee Bass, Emily Bevel, Peyton Cormier, Matthew Craig, Revan Daniels, Nathan Morris, Hanah Stokke, and Reagan Winget

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qq6MRiSTguE&list=UUJzAWQLIpNYdu3DaS2TWaJw&index=2
